statement.p: John Lloyd is conducting market research on the amount typically spent on the purchase of a first vehicle. John Lloyd has determined that the average cost of a first vehicle is 5900, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 760.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected first-time vehicle purchase is more than 4870. (Round to 4 decimal places.)
b. The cost of the middle 50 of first-time vehicle purchases falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
